wiki_description: Catarina "Cat" Valentine (Portrayed by #ArianaGrande) is one of the eight Victorious main characters. Valentine is known as a ditzy, bubbly, cheerful but dim-witted girl who rarely and gets angry, although she is very sensitive. She is Jade and Tori best friend and the Robbie love interest, as the only girl at Hollywood Arts that Rex doesn't hit on.
personality_type: ENFP - 7w6 - sx/so - 792 - IEE - SLUAI - EFVL - Sanguine [Dominant] - EN(F)

topic.description: Catarina "Cat" Valentine is one of the eight main characters on Victorious (Portrayed by #ArianaGrande). She is known as a ditzy, bubbly, cheerful, and dimwitted person who rarely gets angry, although she is very sensitive. She is Jade and Tori’s best friend and Robbie's love interest. She is also the only girl at Hollywood Arts that Rex doesn't hit on.

related_topics.description: Jade West is one of the eight main characters and is one of the four main characters to appear in every episode in the Nickelodeon TV show Victorious (Portrayed by #ElizabethGillies). She used to often serve as an antagonist to Tori Vega on the show, but they are still members of the same friend group. She is Tori’s former frenemy, and Beck's girlfriend.

Catarina "Cat" Valentine is one of the eight main characters on Victorious (Portrayed by #ArianaGrande). She is known as a ditzy, bubbly, cheerful, and dimwitted person who rarely gets angry, although she is very sensitive. She is Jade and Tori’s best friend and Robbie's love interest. She is also the only girl at Hollywood Arts that Rex doesn't hit on.

Tori Vega is the main protagonist of the hit Nickelodeon show, Victorious (Portrayed by #VictoriaJustice). She experiences the biggest change of her life during the Big Showcase when she transfers from Sherwood High School to Hollywood Arts. This enables her to learn more about her craft (acting, singing, and dancing) and make new friends and frenemies. Though she is still sometimes out of her element, she is quickly learning how things work at Hollywood Arts and really doesn't know what's coming next at the anything but ordinary school. She is one of the four main characters to appear in every episode.

Trina Vega is one of the eight main characters in the series and Tori Vega's older sister (Portrayed by #DaniellaMonet). Trina is only one year older than Tori, and is in the senior class at Hollywood Arts. She acts like she is the most talented person at Hollywood Arts, making her friends (and her sister) annoyed.
Erwin Sikowitz is the acting teacher at Hollywood Arts (Portrayed by #EricLange). His teaching style is very strange and odd.

Robert "Robbie" Shapiro is one of the eight main characters on Victorious (Portrayed by #MattBennett). He is a ventriloquist who almost always carries his best friend Rex with him. Robbie is shy, awkward, and a little weird, but he's also a good friend, loyal, honest, and smart. He is a student at Hollywood Arts High School who often gets into minor trouble.

#INTPNerds

André Harris is one of the eight main characters and is one of the four main characters to appear in every episode in Victorious (Portrayed by #LeonThomasIII). He is one of the musically talented best friends of Tori Vega.

Beck Oliver is one of the eight main characters of Victorious (Portrayed by #AvanJogia). He is Jade West's boyfriend and seems to be the leader of the gang. Because of his talents and good-looks and particularly his fluffy hair, he is very popular with girls (as well as young adult women). He also seems to be very calm, wise, and mature at most times. His talent is acting and can be described as a pretty boy.

Sinjin Van Cleef (born August 24, 1995) is a recurring character and a rather odd and somewhat stalker-ish student who goes to Hollywood Arts High School (Portrayed by #MichaelEricReid). Throughout the series, he is shown to have a huge crush on several girls, primarily Jade West, but also Trina Vega, Tori Vega, and Cat Valentine, much to their dismay.

#INTPNerds

Festus is a minor character in Victorious (Portrayed by #MarcoAiello). He's the Yerbanian-American owner, and sole employee, of The Grub Truck, Hollywood Arts's secondary food service for its students.

Fawn Liebowitz (aka Ponnie) is fictional character who appears in the episode Crazy Ponnie (Portrayed by #JennetteMcCurdy). She is a student who befriends Tori but disappears when other people are in sight, making Tori’s friends think that Tori is losing her mind by imagining Ponnie. She has lunch in the girls' bathroom and tells Tori that she was in the spring showcase with Tori, has been going to Hollywood Arts for three years, and that she was kicked out because they needed to make room for Tori. However, it was later revealed that the real reason she was expelled was because she is mentally insane. She stole things, kept weird things in her backpack, and called everyone Debbie, according to Sikowitz. She keeps an evil Tori doll, an ear of corn, and a Klingon dictionary in her backpack. It is also known that Fawn and Sikowitz are not very fond of each other, as she calls him "old hippie" and he calls her a "real nutcase."
Lane Alexander is the school guidance counselor at Hollywood Arts High School (Portrayed by #LaneNapper).

Melinda Murray is a stubborn, surly and extremely unpleasant actress who only appeared in Beck's Big Break (Portrayed by #EllenHollman). She is the main star of the movie, Miss Fire. Melinda fired Beck from the movie because Tori corrected her on a line, and she found out they were friends. Tori went back to the studio and begged Melinda to recast Beck. However, Melinda accidentally yelled the cue for a man to shoot an arrow and was shot in the hand. She was hospitalized and taken off the movie, which resulted in the whole cast and crew rejoicing and thanking Tori since they all hated her for her arrogance.

Charlotte Harris is André Harris's grandmother (Portrayed by #MarylinHarris). She made eight appearances in the series: Pilot, Wi-Fi in the Sky, Sleepover at Sikowitz's, iParty with Victorious, Driving Tori Crazy, Tori Fixes Beck and Jade, and The Bad Roommate. She was briefly mentioned in the episodes Survival of the Hottest, Jade Gets Crushed, Tori Goes Platinum, The Blonde Squad, Tori Fixes Beck and Jade, and The Bad Roommate. According to André, she lost her mind sometime before the series. The big showcase in the Pilot was the first time she left her house in six years due to her irrational fear of virtually everything, such as people, rabbis, bikinis, breakfast foods, vacuum cleaners, refrigerators, the seven year old next door, car horns, showers, and ceiling fans. She is also scared of clocks changing, mirrors, and web chats, as seen in her behavior in Wi-Fi in the Sky, when she punched André's laptop twice, causing the camera to shatter. She is portrayed by Marylin Harris.

Mrs. Lee is the owner of the former restaurant Wok Star and her newest restaurant, Nozu (Portrayed by #SusanChuang). She has a daughter named Daisy who only made an appearance on Wok Star and mentioned on André's Horrible Girl.

Hope Quincy is André's girlfriend in "André's Horrible Girl" (Portrayed by #MeaganHolder). She’s a spoiled, controlling, grouchy and disrespectful brat who forces André to wear the clothes she gives him. She’s the daughter of Shawn Quincy, a famous music producer.

posts.content:
Definitely ENFP, I mean her Ne is what I use to describe an Ne dom as apposed to me as an INFP that uses it as an auxiliary. It’s more today she is gonna combine hot dogs and hamburgers to make hot durgers as apposed to having a theory about it than procrastinating on it.🤷‍♂️  
 
I love her though, not many characters are as adorable as her IMO, maybe it’s the way Ariana plays her but still she makes my day I just love her energy and enthusiasm, plus I love her random *** mind that goes in places you would not expect but comes off as “stupid” to some and I can see why as well but she maintains my interest and I think its oddly brilliant once you think about it, like she’s in her own world so much that it makes you question your own reality alittle bit.  
 
Like she buys some wahoo punch then throws it out or why didn’t you sing the national anthem then get dragged by the dog or whatever I usually find it interesting at least like how did she arrive at that conclusion, plus I like to embrace the random and she is the definition of random.     
 
It’s also interesting how random she is and liberal minded or open minded and open hearted she is considering how hostile her home environment is. Also her parents are at least pretty conservative, they vote republican and go to church. Plus I would imagine the grief her brother puts her and her family through would make them more conservative by default just because they are more in survival mode as apposed to thinking of others or changing the status quo.  
 
But yes I suppose that’s the sort of strategy she chose in order to be happy or deal with the grief and horror of it all, you know goes into her own little world and also to get more attention from her friends and her parents. But it is Nickelodeon so I’m probably reading too far into it but still I find it interesting.  
 
Plus it’s a complicated relationship, her brothers behaviour can be a threat but he’s her brother so she’s has to open her heart to something that can hurt her, Idk I find it interesting.

posts.title: I’m a 9w1 but
posts.content: I have many cat qualities. I think we’d be besties ☺️
